Sample random addresses

Source: R/sample.R
sample.Rd

sample_ipv4() and sample_ipv6() sample from the entire address space; sample_network() samples from a specific network.

Usage

sample_ipv4(size, ..., replace = FALSE)

sample_ipv6(size, ..., replace = FALSE)

sample_network(x, size, ..., replace = FALSE)

Arguments

size

Integer specifying the number of addresses to return

...

These dots are for future extensions and must be empty.

replace

Should sampling be with replacement? (default: FALSE)

x

An ip_network scalar

Value

An ip_address vector

See also

Use seq.ip_network() to generate all addresses in a network.

Examples

sample_ipv4(5)
#> <ip_address[5]>
#> [1] 112.230.25.117  101.96.211.248  59.158.115.151  160.100.107.240
#> [5] 93.201.196.60  

sample_ipv6(5)
#> <ip_address[5]>
#> [1] 5c48:2d4c:4083:1afc:d8fc:d3b:6dab:feff 
#> [2] 2713:a033:a3f3:3e25:f4b:bc91:748b:d3f3 
#> [3] f16b:23a6:a56f:896b:249e:fae8:a012:4da 
#> [4] 3a87:bbeb:c157:91ef:b437:ae37:8482:6c67
#> [5] d04b:4e69:9315:b3d:bebb:116a:4095:f284 

sample_network(ip_network("192.168.0.0/16"), 5)
#> <ip_address[5]>
#> [1] 192.168.15.120  192.168.148.62  192.168.105.151 192.168.175.54 
#> [5] 192.168.24.73  

sample_network(ip_network("2001:db8::/48"), 5)
#> <ip_address[5]>
#> [1] 2001:db8:0:dfe4:420c:14f0:58d7:1fa5 2001:db8:0:dc1e:ef7d:246f:ec34:f618
#> [3] 2001:db8:0:ae5d:9941:5b2c:bff6:7a6  2001:db8:0:db5a:185b:3e2b:9adf:2fb2
#> [5] 2001:db8:0:8154:31ff:51e6:10f2:cb25
